Articles.Content:
Hi. I am Cuso. I am a computer engineer from Turkey. I'm 28.

I am pretty new to Kerbal Space Program. I've played it around 6 hours. That 6 hours was enough for me to realise KSP is not just a regular game and I will need lots of help about it.

This is the first time I've registered to a game forum. I hope, I can get some help and help others later.

Good luck and enjoy KSP

Hello Cuso, and welcome to the forums!

If you're looking for help playing, you've come to the right place. Some good starting points are the Gameplay Questions section and the Tutorials subsection. Of particular note is a thread called The Drawing Board, which is a compendium of other tutorials and resources.

Also, be sure to look around the KSP Wiki. This is an invaluable resource for players new and old.

Happy landings!

Hi Cuso!

Welcome! Starhawk had some pretty good links. Check them out!

Welcome aboard!!!

Ah yes, that moment you realize Kerbal Space Program is like crack and you binge play for hours. Was it 6 hours straight or did you take a break?

There is a lot to learn. Don't get overwhelmed. Take your time and get a good grasp on the basics. You need to build upon these skills to progress and do a lot more going forward.

@Starhawk Thank you for your answer and for the links, I am sure they will help me a lot. Happy landings to you too

@Dman979 Thank you for your answer and advise, i will check them out

@iBeej Thank you for your answer and attention, I did take some breaks maybe around 1 hour. And thank you for your advises, I will remember them.
